Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment

official_title: A bill to provide for the orderly implementation of Environmental Protection Agency pesticide regulations issued to comply with the Endangered Species Act of 1973.

summary.text: Prohibits the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from cancelling or suspending a pesticide registration or finding a pesticide misbranded on the basis of noncompliance with the Endangered Species Act for a period ending after January 1989. Requires the Administrator and the Secretary of the Interior to jointly study the economic impact of any change in pesticide regulations which may be proposed in compliance with such Act and report to the chairmen of specified congressional committees on the results. Directs the Administrator and Secretary to jointly inform affected persons of requirements which may be imposed under such Act.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the orderly implementation of Environmental Protection Agency pesticide regulations issued to comply with the Endangered Species Act of 1973.
